inlineContent.text: Control the map’s initial position, zoom level, and rotation angle
using MapCamera and MapCameraPosition.
MapCameraPosition defines where the map should display.
It supports various methods including automatic positioning, specific coordinates, and regions.
Automatically adjusts camera position to fit the content.
It auto-zooms so all markers are visible.
Automatic Position (.automatic)
Specify an exact position using CLLocationCoordinate2D.
Let’s display the map centered on Seoul City Hall.
Centering on Specific Coordinates (.camera)
Specifying a Region (.region)
Define the visible area using MKCoordinateRegion.
Fine-tune the zoom level with span.
Two-way Connection with @Binding
When the user moves the map, the position updates.
When you programmatically change the position, the map moves.
Camera Distance (distance)
Set the distance in meters between the camera and the ground.
Smaller values zoom in, larger values zoom out.
Camera Pitch (pitch)
0° is vertical (looking straight down), and you can tilt up to 85°.
Combined with 3D building views, it creates an immersive experience.
Camera Heading (heading)
0° is north, 90° is east, 180° is south.
Controls the rotation direction of the map.

with MapCamera.

A vertical top-down view looking straight down
A pitch of 0° is a completely vertical top-down view.
As the value increases, it tilts toward the horizon.
A side view parallel to the horizon
To get closer to a side view, increase the pitch (up to 85°).
A view looking up from below
MapCamera’s pitch ranges from 0° to 85°.
Looking up from below is not supported.
